entry.title: Re: Connection BAS to TRL instance (Abap trial), Cloud Tr...
entry.content:
Hello Alfredo,
 
please don't follow the tutorial https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/abap-custom-ui-bas-connect-s4hc.html for connecting BAS with ABAP trial instance as it is intended specifically for S/4HANA Cloud systems.

To my knowledge the steps in the tutorial https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/abap-environment-deploy-fiori-elements-ui.html should still work for an ABAP trial instance. I tested this briefly with my own trial account and instance:

1. Followed https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/abap-environment-trial-onboarding.html for initial ABAP trial onboarding.
2. Then followed https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/abap-environment-deploy-fiori-elements-ui.html with some minor adjustments:
Step 4.5: I used the SSO Passcode option to ensure I was logged in with my trial account user.
Step 5.4: The destination for default_abap-trial is not created during initial onboarding. You need to create it manually by selecting Cloud Foundry ABAP environment on SAP BTP and then choosing ABAP environment default_abap-trial.

Then it is possible for me to select the system and service successfully.

 



 

From your screenshot, I see an ABAP environment instance named MyNewAbapserver. If there are issues, you could delete its corresponding destination and recreate the destination for default_abap-trial from BAS as described above.
Also, please ensure you are using the same user across your ABAP trial account, ABAP trial instance, and BAS.

Hope this helps!

Best regards,
Peter

You are absolutely right. We've verified that the translation of "Material" to "자재" (Raw Material) is an error in the ESG context and needs to be corrected by our development team. We appreciate you for pointing this out with such clarity.

Thank you once again for helping us improve our solution. Please let us know if you have any questions during the incident creation process.

Best regards,
Kauê Da Hora

entry.title: EF Core 9 migrations fail with SAP HANA provider due to missing IMigrationsDatabaseLock support
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are using SAP HANA Cloud (service type: schema) from an ASP.NET Core application with Entity Framework Core 9 and the Sap.EntityFrameworkCore.Hana provider.

We are facing a blocking issue when using EF Core migrations.

Problem description

When executing migrations (for example, by calling Database.Migrate() during application startup), EF Core throws the following exception:

System.NotSupportedException:
Generating idempotent scripts for migrations is not currently supported for SQLite

The exception occurs in the following method:

IMigrationsDatabaseLock AcquireDatabaseLock()

Important clarification

We were previously using EF Core 6, where migrations worked by generating SQL scripts manually.

The application is correctly connected to SAP HANA Cloud and works properly as long as migrations are not executed.

We are not using SQLite; the error appears to be caused by internal reuse of SQLite migration infrastructure in the HANA provider.

Impact

This makes EF Core migrations unusable with SAP HANA, even when:

  • Using SAP HANA Cloud

  • Using schema-based services

  • Having full DDL permissions

As a result, migrations cannot be applied.

Request / Question

Is there any plan to:

  • Properly implement IMigrationsDatabaseLock for SAP HANA?

  • Remove or replace the SQLite-based fallback in the HANA EF Core provider?

  • Officially support EF Core 9 migrations, even if only partially (as was possible with version 6)?

At the moment, EF Core + HANA can only be safely used as an ORM, not as a schema management tool.

Any guidance, roadmap, or official recommendation would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: SuccessFactors Succession + TaIent Intelligence Hub : Make Skills Decision-Grade
entry.content:
In SuccessFactors Succession, AI-assisted successor recommendations are only as good as the Talent Intelligence Hub (TIH) data behind them.

If your Growth Portfolio skills aren’t decision-grade, your successor list won’t be either.

The demo looks magical. Production feels… haunted!!
Because when proficiency is decorative instead of governed, the system can’t separate a “keyword match” from real role readiness, and trust collapses fast.

And that’s when you start seeing it in live tenants: These are real examples, I and my customers experienced during the implementations. 

  • A junior developer appears as a top successor for a VP role because a CV mentioned “strategic planning”.
  • Growth Portfolio turns into a digital junk drawer: everyone is an “Expert” in everything.
  • Managers stop trusting recommendations because they can’t explain why someone was suggested.

The uncomfortable truth:
The AI isn’t the root problem. The skills data is.
More specifically: skills without governed proficiency become decorative proficiency.

When proficiency is treated like profile decoration instead of a controlled data point, AI-assisted matching is forced to guess.

The adoption paradox in Talent Intelligence Hub

Recent TIH capabilities such as resume-based skill extraction (Add from Resume) and AI-assisted skill recommendations/inference reduce the effort to propose and capture skills, which typically increases adoption.

That’s the paradox:

  • Adoption goes up.
  • Signal quality goes down.
  • Trust collapses.
  • Successor suggestions start drifting, because the data becomes noisy.

This is how organizations unintentionally build a “skills-based organization” on top of unverified keywords.

What’s really happening under the hood

AI-assisted recommendations can only be as reliable as the signals you maintain. At minimum, you need clarity on:

  • Skill present (what’s listed)
  • Proficiency level (how strong)
  • Verification / evidence discipline (how do we know)
  • Recency (is it current)
  • Role expectations (what “advanced” means in this role)

When the system has skills but not governed proficiency plus verification discipline, it’s forced to treat too many things as equivalent.

Result: skill inflation produces role-readiness inflation.

The 4-step shift from decoration to data integrity

Before doubling down on AI-assisted successor experiences, four governance questions need clear answers. If these aren’t defined, the system isn’t “smart” -- it’s guessing.

1) Who owns the proficiency scale definition?

Most organizations have “a global scale”. But here’s the trap:

“Advanced” in coding ≠ “Advanced” in sales ≠ “Advanced” in leadership.

If language is standardized but context is ignored, you get inconsistent ratings and inconsistent recommendations.

What to do

  • Assign a true owner: HRIS together with the Talent COE.
  • Define proficiency levels as observable outcomes, not adjectives.

Example outcome-based language

  • Can perform with supervision.
  • Can perform independently.
  • Can coach others / lead complex work.
  • Can define standards / shape strategy.

If it can’t be observed, it can’t be governed.
If it can’t be governed, AI outputs cannot be trusted.

2) Who approves changes (and how is it audited)?

Self-service skills are great for development.
Self-service proficiency that influences succession and other high-stakes talent decisions is risk.

If someone jumps from Level 2 → Level 5 overnight, is that:

  • Growth?
  • Or data tampering (intentional or accidental)?

What to do: create a verification layer for high-impact data.

A practical model that works in real implementations

  • Employees can add skills and self-rate for personal development.
  • For critical skills (succession, key roles, compliance, decision-grade use cases):
    • Require manager verification, peer endorsement, or assessment evidence.
    • Log changes (who, when, what changed, previous vs new).

Outcome: adoption stays high while the signals that matter are protected.

3) What happens when the proficiency scale changes?

This is hidden technical debt in TIH.

If you:

  • move from 5-level → 3-level (to simplify the UI),
  • rename levels, or
  • adjust definitions,

…what happens to years of historical ratings?

Without mapping rules, analytics can show “drops” or “improvements” that are purely structural - not real performance shifts.

What to do: build a simple Change Control Protocol

  • Version scale definitions.
  • Define mapping logic (e.g., old 4–5 → new “Expert”).
  • Communicate changes to managers.
  • Update reporting logic to prevent false trend narratives.

Outcome: People Analytics remains meaningful, and readiness signals stay comparable over time.

4) Can managers explain proficiency in plain language?

Managers avoid rating scales when they feel like grading people.

If the scale is “Level 1–5” with vague labels, the result is often:

  • Inflated ratings
  • Avoidance or random selection
  • Inconsistent adoption across teams

What to do: translate the scale into manager-friendly language

  • Can do this with supervision.
  • Can do this independently.
  • Can coach others.
  • Can lead or design solutions.
  • Can set standards or define strategy.

Then embed this language in:

  • In-app guidance and field help
  • Enablement materials and internal playbooks
  • Manager training with examples anchored in real roles

Outcome: better manager participation, less inflation, higher-quality signals, and stronger recommendations.

What “good” looks like: a simple operating model

For AI-assisted successor recommendations to be credible, three layers must work together.

Layer 1: Adoption (keep it easy)

  • Resume-based extraction and AI-assisted skill recommendations into Growth Portfolio
  • Self-service skill additions
  • Employee-driven development and exploration

Layer 2: Governance (protect the signals)

  • A clearly defined critical skills list (for decision-grade use cases)
  • Verification workflows (manager, peer, or assessment-based)
  • Audit trail and change monitoring for high-impact attributes

Layer 3: Readiness (make it decision-grade)

  • Role expectations aligned to skills and proficiency scales
  • Evidence and recency captured alongside ratings where feasible
  • Reporting that separates signal from noise, not just counts skills

A “Week 1” checklist you can actually use

  • Identify critical roles for succession, leadership, and niche skills.
  • Define critical skills tied to those roles in the Attributes Library.
  • Confirm proficiency scale definitions and rewrite them as observable outcomes.
  • Implement verification for critical-skill proficiency changes.
  • Add audit monitoring (large jumps, frequent changes, spikes by org).
  • Create scale-change mapping and version control conventions.
  • Train managers using plain-language guidance and examples.
  • Build a dashboard that tracks adoption vs verification vs inflation indicators.

The bottom line: AI infrastructure is human infrastructure

As “skills-based organization” moves from buzzword to operating model, success depends less on features and more on data engineering, governance, and change management.

If proficiency is treated like decoration, AI-assisted successor recommendations will remain a toy.
If proficiency is treated as a governed signal, TIH becomes decision-grade and the ROI becomes real.

Over to the community

  1. Are you seeing skill inflation in Growth Portfolio after expanding skill capture (resume-based extraction, inference, self-service)?
  2. How are you governing proficiency credibility without killing adoption?
  3. What verification model works best for you - manager approval, peer endorsement, assessments, or something else?

Conclusion

With the full SuccessFactors suite, you can implement most of what this blog recommends through standard configuration. For the more “advanced” elements, such as monitoring, evidence, and dashboards, you can extend the foundation using People Analytics / SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Intelligent Services, and reporting. Only a few components are primarily operating-model decisions (governance, ownership, and change control) rather than something you can enable with a single switch in Admin Center. That’s the point: when you treat skills and proficiency as governed signals, Succession recommendations become explainable, defensible, and trusted.

entry.title: Re: Is the SAP BI Platform Support Tool (BIPST) developme...
entry.content: Hi Roberto,

entry.title: Re: Is the SAP BI Platform Support Tool (BIPST) developme...
entry.content:
Hi Roberto, 

The latest release as version 2.1.16 (Patch 16) of the BI Platform Support Tool (BIPST) introduces a key enhancements detailed below:

  • Fully compatible with BI 2025 and BI 4.3+.

  • Upgraded the runtime from Java 8 to SAP JVM 17 for improved security and performance.

  • Added a Java SDK File Analyzer to scan local directories for required dependencies and identify version conflicts.

  • Removed the E2E Trace Wizard, as tracing is now natively integrated into the Fiori BI Launchpad.

  • Deprecated the SAML Configuration Wizard due to new authentication models in BI 2025 and BI 4.3 SP04.

  • Removed legacy utilities including the Screen Recorder, Passport Decoder, and Webi Doc Masker.

  • Cleaned up the Landscape Report by removing deprecated tabs for Explorer and Dashboard components.

  • Fixed a bug where the Change Analysis Page would hang when processing non-standard authentication types.

  • Updated the README with clearer installation steps for both Windows and Linux users.

entry.title: Organización de Servicio y estructura organizativa en S4 HANA Public Edition
entry.content:
Hola  a todos !
Buenos días comunidad, 
 @Javier_del-Peso  quisiera hacerle una consulta a usted y a la comunidad también, si pudieran darnos aportes sobre el caso a continuación

Estamos trabajando en una implementación de una empresa que ofrece servicios profesionales (consultoría, soporte y venta de licencias).

Estamos enfrentando un desafío al momento de querer crear una Organización de servicio (necesaria para crear proyectos de servicios profesionales) y al momento de hacerlo aparece el siguiente mensaje:  "Plant 1100 is not assigned to Purch. Org. 1000 and Sales Org. 1100 "

Según nos han respondido en un caso a SAP, nos indicaron que faltaba asignar al área de ventas el centro. 

En la actividad "Set Up Organizational Structure". Debido a nuestro modelo de negocio, necesitamos vincular varias Áreas de Ventas a un mismo Centro, ya que nuestra sucursal 1 (Centro) es la que presta los servicios para todas las áreas de venta (Sector Público, Privado, etc.).

El problema: Una vez que queremos asignar en el CBC un Centro a un Área de Ventas específica, ese Centro deja de estar disponible en la lista de selección para cualquier otra Área de Ventas. Se aplica una relación N:1 que no nos permite avanzar

Consultas para la comunidad:

  1. ¿Existe alguna forma específica en CBC para permitir la asignación de "Un Centro a Muchas Áreas de Ventas"?

  2. Para quienes trabajan en la industria de servicios: ¿Cómo modelan su estructura cuando un solo punto de entrega (Centro) atiende múltiples canales comerciales (Áreas de Ventas)?

  3. ¿Conocen algún paso adicional para habilitar esta asignación?

Adjunto una imágenes de nuestra estructura (la sociedad X-1000 es la prestadora de Servicios)

 

 

Según se visualiza en esta última imagen se espera poder vincular el mismo centro a distintas áreas de ventas

¡Agradezco de antemano cualquier guía o mejor práctica que puedan compartir!

entry.title: Route Train support process: pickup of HUs after unloading has started
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA for Manufacturing Logistics, route trains usually bring goods from the warehouse to destinations (usually production supply areas) in the warehouse where they are e.g. consumed and put into new products.

The supply process can start with a variety of warehouse request document categories like e.g. WMRs for JIT, Kanban with WHR or inbound deliveries. 

We supported up to 2310 FPS01 the additional loading of an HU before the unloading has started. But when the unloading had started it was not possible to add additional HUs onto the tour.

The support of cleanup processes like Clear PSA or on-demand pickup of HUs from PSAs was not supported until SAP S/4HANA for Manufacturing Logistics 2310 FPS01.

With this release we support the pickup of HUs on the stops of a route with a variety of process variants:

  • HU with loading warehouse task to endpoint of the route
  • HU without loading warehouse task to endpoint of the route
  • HU with loading warehouse task for putaway beyond endpoint of the route
  • HU without loading warehouse task for putaway beyond endpoint of the route

The HU can either be a structured HU (aka rack) or a usual HU, it can contain products or other HUs or it can be empty.  This gives the users a lot of freedom in the logistics processes. 

Preconditions

The HU which shall be moved back to the warehouse must meet the following requirements:

  • There must be no route assigned to the HU
  • There is no reference document in the HU item available

You can maintain the destination bin e.g. manually in the EWM warehouse monitor under e.g. Documents – Handling Units and then chose the method “Change HU Destination Data”.

If the destination is not part of the current route then the system assumes a multi-step processing from the current bin of the HU to the final bin:

  • movement to the endpoint of the route
  • movement from there with standard EWM routing to the destination.

To achieve the warehouse task to the final destination ,the system determines the way to the endpoint using the putaway strategy to get the correct warehouse process type and possible intermediate steps. 

 

Process description

The operator is on a tour for unloading HUs to stops and unloads HUs. This means that the status of the tour is already “Unloading started”.

After the first HUs have been unloaded the operator can pickup an HU which is at a stop of the current tour.  The operator choses the function code CF1 for Pick up HUs.

Figure 1: Pickup in RF 

The operator enters the HU ID of the picked-up HU. As the HU is not a rack the system requests a destination HU; the operator scans one of the existing racks. The system creates an unloading warehouse task for the picked-up HU to the destination bin of the route.

Figure 2: Pickup in RF: Enter source HU 

Figure 3: Pickup in RF: Enter destination HU 

The operator then continues the unloading process and returns to the endpoint of the route. The confirmation of the endpoint of the route also confirms the unloading warehouse task for the picked-up HU and posts all empties to the endpoint of the route. 

Conclusion

From an operation perspective this scenario can be enhanced with additional warehouse tasks from the endpoint of the route to e.g. an empties buffer or to another staging area or picking process.

It finally gives the users the possibility to have an overview about empty HUs in the supply process; this was not available so far. 

More details can be found here.

entry.title: What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management 2512
entry.content:
As we wrap up 2025, we’ve focused on strengthening core capabilities in SAP Asset Performance Management (APM). This includes transitioning additional applications to the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) and enabling embedded analytics for the embedded IoT platform.

Before we dive into the blog, the APM product management team would also like to invite you to join the following webcasts coming up in the New Year:

  • Roadmap Update H1/2026 - SAP Asset Performance Management  Thursday, January 29, 2026 at 4:00 PM Central European Time.
  • What’s New in SAP Asset Performance Management 2602  Weednesday, February 18, 2026 at 4:00 PM Central European Time.

Without further ado, let's check out APM release 2512!

Migration of Risk and Criticality Assessments and Assessment Templates to SAP Cloud Application Programming model (CAP)

SAP Asset Performance Management (APM) is undergoing a significant transition to the SAP Cloud Application Programming (CAP) model. This transition aims to enhance the functionality, scalability, and maintainability of the APM applications.

With this release the Manage Risk & Criticality Assessments and Manage Templates for Risk and Criticality Assessments have transitioned.

Challenge

The original Risk and Criticality Assessments and Assessment Templates had limited flexibility for custom or industry-specific data and did not allow field extensibility to add custom fields,  timeline changes and standard sort and search capability across its list object detail views.
 
The new CAP apps offer the following
  • Improved user experience with more intuitive and efficient management of risk and criticality assessment templates and risk and criticality assessments
  • Possibility to add custom fields via extensibility to enable capturing industry-specific data

For more information, see Asset Risk Assessment on the SAP Help Portal.

New Access Point to new CAP-Based Risk and Criticality apps, plus examples

Find Out More

  • For an introduction into extensibility in APM, read this blog by Archi Garg Extending SAP Asset Performance Management (APM): Three Approaches to Tailoring Your Asset Operations.  
  • For details on how to extend the application, see the SAP Help Portal SaaS Extensibility for Asset Performance Management. and watch this space for a step-by-step video guide - coming soon.
  • For more details on the new CAP-based applications, including required roles, see the SAP Help Portal Asset Risk Assessment. 
  • For more information on release timelines, support, and known limitations, refer to SAP Note 3603407.

 

 

Attribute-Based Access Control Enabled for Alerts

Alerts are now shown only for the technical objects you’re authorized to manage.

Challenge

It was previously not possible to restrict the list of alerts visible to a user based on the technical objects they are responsible for or authorized to manage. As a result, users could see alerts beyond their scope of responsibility, increasing complexity and raising concerns around security and compliance.

Solution

To address this, attribute-based access control (ABAC) has been implemented for alerts. Alert visibility is now determined by attributes of the related technical objects — specifically Maintenance Plant and Planning Plant.

By evaluating these attributes against user authorizations, the system ensures that users can only view alerts associated with technical objects for which they have the appropriate permissions and responsibilities. 

To enable this behavior, the role AccessControlAttributeProvider must be assigned to the user.

Outcome

With attribute-based access control in place, organizations benefit from:

  • Enhanced security and granular access control through restricted alert visibility
  • Support for company-wide rollout, enabling refined access controls across roles and teams
  • Improved compliance, aligning alert access with company policies and regulatory requirements

To sum up, alerts are now delivered to the right users improving focus, accountability, and trust in the system.

For more information, see:

  • Attribute-Based Access Control Role Template
  • Viewing Alerts

Interactive Embedded Analytics Dashboards

The Manage Analytics Dashboard application is now available for the Embedded IoT tenants. It provides interactive charts and tables to visualize data from SAP Asset Performance Management. This helps you analyze and explore the data effectively, leading to valuable insights for improved asset management. For more information, see Manage Analytics Dashboards.

Note that in this release we have only enabled embedded SAC capabilities.

Stay Informed and Get Involved

  • Don't forget to sign up for the upcoming webcasts in January and February 2026 (Roadmap Update H1/2026 - SAP Asset Performance Management and What’s New in SAP Asset Performance Management 2602)
  • You can also explore our latest blog posts here, including topics such as Embedded IoT by @florian_weigold, Industrial Systems by @SonamKinger, and the extensibility blog by @archigarg mentioned earlier.
  • Find out what's up and coming in the SAP Road Map Explorer.
  • For an exhaustive list of all new features, visit the SAP Help Portal - What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management.. 
  • Send us your improvement requests. Submit or vote for the improvement you would like to see in the SAP Continuous Influence session.
  • Check the APM link collection. 

Let us know what you think about these new features - leave us a comment below or ask a question! 

Enjoy the holiday season and see you in the new year for the 2601 update!

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA PMMO Distribution Failure – Project-Valua...
entry.content:
PMMO/GPD only works with Non-Valuated Stock. 

When moving inventory of Non-Valuated Stock it is a quantity only transfer, the Distribution part of GPD is the transfer of the value.  The main use case of PMMO are customers that want Non-Valuated stock so they incur project expenses at GR and not having to wait for GI.

If you want Valuated stock you typically won't need PMMO since material transfers move quantity and value.  With Valuated Stock you can still use Requirements Grouping but you don't need the Distribution.

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to increase run time for Analysis Work...
entry.content:
Histephen_hobbs2

You can try to increase the run time for Analysis Workbook scheduling on BIP in CMC.  Access the Central Management Console (CMC) in your BusinessObjects with Administrative rights. Navigate to Servers from upper left dropdown, select Service Categories and Core Services /[SIA_NAME].AdaptiveJobServer; One or more of job servers kind is your AdaptiveJobServer with Analysis Office Scheduling Service. Find this service by checking Properties of the servers. 

In this service configuration one can set relevant timeout for the precalculation process. More details about Scheduling of Analysis for Office  Workbooks setup you an find in note: https://me.sap.com/notes/2134836

entry.title: Re: editable alv report
entry.content:
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Report Z_EKPO_EDITABLE_SALV
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Purpose: Display Purchase Order Items (EKPO) with editable columns
*& using CL_SALV_TABLE and modern ABAP 7.5+ syntax
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
REPORT z_ekpo_editable_salv.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Type Definitions
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_ekpo,
ebeln TYPE ekpo-ebeln, " Purchase Order Number
ebelp TYPE ekpo-ebelp, " PO Item Number
aedat TYPE ekpo-aedat, " Change Date
txz01 TYPE ekpo-txz01, " Short Text (Editable)
matnr TYPE ekpo-matnr, " Material Number
menge TYPE ekpo-menge, " Quantity (Editable)
netwr TYPE ekpo-netwr, " Net Value (Editable)
END OF ty_ekpo.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Selection Screen
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
SELECT-OPTIONS: s_ebeln FOR ekpo-ebeln.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Global Variables
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
DATA: gt_ekpo TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_ekpo,
go_salv TYPE REF TO cl_salv_table,
go_grid TYPE REF TO cl_gui_alv_grid.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Event Handler Class
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
CLASS lcl_event_handler DEFINITION.
PUBLIC SECTION.
CLASS-METHODS:
" Handle toolbar button events
on_user_command FOR EVENT added_function OF cl_salv_events
IMPORTING e_salv_function,

" Handle data changes in the grid
on_data_changed FOR EVENT data_changed OF cl_gui_alv_grid
IMPORTING er_data_changed.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_event_handler IMPLEMENTATION.

METHOD on_user_command.
CASE e_salv_function.
WHEN 'SAVE'.
" Trigger grid to flush changes to internal table
CALL METHOD go_grid->check_changed_data.

" Here you would implement your save logic
" For standard tables like EKPO, use BAPIs or RAP instead of direct MODIFY
MESSAGE 'Data saved successfully (use BAPI in production)' TYPE 'S'.

WHEN OTHERS.
ENDCASE.
ENDMETHOD.

METHOD on_data_changed.
" This event is triggered when user modifies cells
" You can add custom validations here
DATA(lt_modified) = er_data_changed->mt_good_cells.

LOOP AT lt_modified INTO DATA(ls_mod).
" Add your validation logic here
" Example: Check if quantity is positive
IF ls_mod-fieldname = 'MENGE'.
DATA(lv_value) = CONV menge_d( ls_mod-value ).
IF lv_value <= 0.
" Flag error
er_data_changed->add_protocol_entry(
i_msgid = '00'
i_msgno = '001'
i_msgty = 'E'
i_msgv1 = 'Quantity must be positive'
i_fieldname = ls_mod-fieldname
i_row_id = ls_mod-row_id ).
ENDIF.
ENDIF.
ENDLOOP.
ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* START-OF-SELECTION
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
START-OF-SELECTION.
PERFORM select_data.
PERFORM display_alv.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* FORM select_data
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM select_data.

" Modern inline declaration with host variable escaping (@)
SELECT ebeln, ebelp, aedat, txz01, matnr, menge, netwr
FROM ekpo
WHERE ebeln IN @s_ebeln
INTO TABLE @gt_ekpo
UP TO 100 ROWS.

IF sy-subrc <> 0.
MESSAGE 'No data found' TYPE 'I'.
LEAVE LIST-PROCESSING.
ENDIF.

ENDFORM.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
* FORM display_alv
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM display_alv.

TRY.
" Create SALV instance using factory method
cl_salv_table=>factory(
IMPORTING
r_salv_table = go_salv
CHANGING
t_table = gt_ekpo ).

" Configure columns
DATA(lo_columns) = go_salv->get_columns( ).
lo_columns->set_optimize( abap_true ).

" Set column labels
DATA(lo_column) = CAST cl_salv_column_table( lo_columns->get_column( 'EBELN' ) ).
lo_column->set_long_text( 'Purchase Order' ).
lo_column->set_medium_text( 'PO Number' ).
lo_column->set_short_text( 'PO' ).

lo_column = CAST cl_salv_column_table( lo_columns->get_column( 'EBELP' ) ).
lo_column->set_long_text( 'Item Number' ).

lo_column = CAST cl_salv_column_table( lo_columns->get_column( 'TXZ01' ) ).
lo_column->set_long_text( 'Short Text' ).

lo_column = CAST cl_salv_column_table( lo_columns->get_column( 'MENGE' ) ).
lo_column->set_long_text( 'Quantity' ).

lo_column = CAST cl_salv_column_table( lo_columns->get_column( 'NETWR' ) ).
lo_column->set_long_text( 'Net Value' ).

" Enable standard functions (toolbar buttons)
DATA(lo_functions) = go_salv->get_functions( ).
lo_functions->set_all( abap_true ).

" Add custom SAVE button
TRY.
lo_functions->add_function(
name = 'SAVE'
icon = '@2L@'
text = 'Save'
tooltip = 'Save changes'
position = if_salv_c_function_position=>right_of_salv_functions ).
CATCH cx_salv_existing cx_salv_wrong_call.
ENDTRY.

" Register event handler for toolbar buttons
DATA(lo_events) = go_salv->get_event( ).
SET HANDLER lcl_event_handler=>on_user_command FOR lo_events.

" *** ENABLE EDITING - Two approaches depending on your release ***

" Approach 1: For SAP NetWeaver 7.56+ and S/4HANA (Official API)
TRY.
DATA(lo_editable) = go_salv->extended_grid_api( )->editable_restricted( ).

" Make specific columns editable
lo_editable->set_attributes_for_columnname(
columnname = 'TXZ01'
all_cells_input_enabled = abap_true ).

lo_editable->set_attributes_for_columnname(
columnname = 'MENGE'
all_cells_input_enabled = abap_true ).

lo_editable->set_attributes_for_columnname(
columnname = 'NETWR'
all_cells_input_enabled = abap_true ).

CATCH cx_salv_error INTO DATA(lx_error).
" If extended_grid_api is not available, use Approach 2
MESSAGE lx_error->get_text( ) TYPE 'I'.
ENDTRY.

" Approach 2: Access underlying CL_GUI_ALV_GRID (for older releases)
" Uncomment if Approach 1 fails
* DATA: lo_grid_adapter TYPE REF TO cl_salv_gui_table_ida.
* go_grid ?= go_salv->r_controller_r_table->r_model->r_grid.
*
* IF go_grid IS BOUND.
* " Set grid to input-ready mode
* go_grid->set_ready_for_input( 1 ).
*
* " Register data change event
* go_grid->register_edit_event( cl_gui_alv_grid=>mc_evt_modified ).
* SET HANDLER lcl_event_handler=>on_data_changed FOR go_grid.
*
* " Define which columns are editable via field catalog
* go_grid->get_frontend_fieldcatalog( IMPORTING et_fieldcatalog = DATA(lt_fcat) ).
* LOOP AT lt_fcat ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_fcat>).
* CASE <fs_fcat>-fieldname.
* WHEN 'TXZ01' OR 'MENGE' OR 'NETWR'.
* <fs_fcat>-edit = abap_true.
* ENDCASE.
* ENDLOOP.
* go_grid->set_frontend_fieldcatalog( lt_fcat ).
* ENDIF.

" Display the grid
go_salv->display( ).

CATCH cx_salv_msg INTO DATA(lx_msg).
MESSAGE lx_msg->get_text( ) TYPE 'E'.
ENDTRY.

ENDFORM.

entry.title: Crystal Reports Conversion From UNV to UNX
entry.content:
Has anyone else been working on converting Crystal reports 2020 reports from using UNV universes to UNX universes?

We have started on our conversion work and have found an issue where the relationship to the UNV universe is still retained after the universe is published to Business Objects.

— Steps to Reproduce —

Start with a Crystal Reports 2020 report that uses a UNV universe as a source.

  1. Set the datasource location to point to the equivalent UNX universe.
  2. Save the repointed Crystal Report out to Business Objects Enterprise by overwriting the existing Crystal Report.
  3. Observe that the Crystal Report in Business Objects is still referencing the UNV universe as well as the UNX universe by looking at the report properties and the default universe.

I found 3280081 - Webi report associated with both unv and unx after promotion ( SAP site login required) and implemented the fix but it does not appear to have any effect on Crystal Reports. As a side note, we have not encountered the issue from this KBA with our Web Intelligence reports as of yet but we are using APOS Web Intelligence Migrator to convert our Web Intelligence reports and that may have some impact.

entry.title: UNLOCK Webi Chart Colors from Dimension Values
entry.content:
Is there a way to permanently UNLOCK palette colors from dimension values in a Webi bar chart?

We have a Webi document we run once a year to show the past three years of data in a vertical bar chart.  We want the same three colors to be used every time we run the Webi document, regardless of the three years values that appear.  We would like the most recent year’s bar to always be BLUE, the previous year’s bar to always be GREEN, and the oldest year’s bar to always be PINK.

Unfortunately, I cannot seem to find a way to UNLOCK the color assignments from the year values.  Each year we run the Webi document, the colors shift with the year values.  They are locked to the Year dimensions values.  Turning off custom assignments for each data series isn’t fixing the issue.  Neither is changing the palette.

Is there a way to UNLOCK the color assignments so the same three colors are used regardless of the Year dimension values?

entry.title: Re: Practice system to test TM-EWM Integration
entry.content:
Hi Sonal

I’ve been looking into a cost-effective way to practice with S/4HANA (TM/EWM), and here is a workaround I found:

You can leverage the SAP Cloud Appliance Library (CAL) "Fully Activated Stack," which offers a 30-day free trial license. For the infrastructure, you can use the $300 welcome credits from Google Cloud or Azure. By linking both, the cloud credits cover the server costs while you study.

Deployment Steps (Setup)

  • SAP CAL Account: Log in to cal.sap.com using your S-User or P-User.
  • Choose the Solution: Search for "SAP S/4HANA Fully Activated Stack." This version is essential as it includes pre-configured TM and EWM scenarios.
  • Cloud Link (Hyperscaler): Connect your AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud account.
  • Create Instance: Once you click "Create Instance," SAP CAL automates the entire Linux, HANA, and S/4HANA installation.

I haven't tested myself, so be cautious.

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602 upgrade is approaching, and now is the right time to ensure your organization is fully prepared.

To support customers through this lifecycle event, SAP provides the SAP Activate for Upgrade of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) road map. This roadmap is designed to help you plan, execute, and stabilize your system before, during, and after the upgrade—using a structured, proven approach.

Why use the SAP Activate for Upgrade roadmap?

The roadmap:

  • Guides you through upgrade preparation, testing, and post-upgrade activities
  • Aligns tasks in sequential order with recommended timing
  • Links directly to accelerators and tools when you need them
  • Can be used as a standalone mini-project or integrated into ongoing initiatives

Whether you are already live with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition or managing an active implementation, the SAP Activate for Upgrade of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) road map provides clarity and structure throughout the upgrade process.

Take time now to review the roadmap, plan your activities, and align your teams. Early preparation helps minimize risk and ensures a smoother upgrade. For more information on the upgrade schedule and key dates, please visit the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, 3-System Landscape - Upgrade & Maintenance Schedule.

We encourage you to explore the SAP Activate for Upgrade of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) road map  and leverage it as your central guide for the upcoming 2602 public cloud upgrade.

Happy upgrading!

entry.title: Extract Rev-Trac requests by custom program and Rev-Trac API
entry.content:
• Introduction
  • What is the Rev-Trac API?
  • Rev-Trac RFC destination
  • /RSC/API_GET_REQUESTS
  • Program to extract the custom long text fields of requests
  • Table ZRSC_REQ_COPY
  • ABAP Code

 

Introduction

In this post, I propose a program to do a full-text search in custom long text field(s) of Rev-Trac requests stored on a central Rev-Trac system, by RFC. For searching fast, the program stores the data in a custom table and refreshes it by querying the last changed requests (delta mode). This post also helps developers to find and call remotely Rev-Trac API function modules. I also created this post because there are very few resources talking about custom development with Rev-Trac.

Rev-Trac is a software to manage SAP Change Requests, all SAP Transport Requests which belong to one feature are assigned to one Rev-Trac request and there are controls to make sure that there's no conflict with other features when delivering the feature (a little bit like SAP ChaRM).

Rev-Trac is installed both in a central system which contains all Rev-Trac data, and in all the ABAP systems where the SAP transport requests are located, which connect to the central system via RFC.

I'm using an old Rev-Trac version ("Rev-Trac Master API version: 7.2.0" via the transaction code /RSC/RT > menu Administration > Rev-Trac version) so maybe this program cannot be used on the latest versions (as far as I can see, right now the last version is around 8.3.6).

About the context:

  • My current client has interfaced Rev-Trac with a Project Management system (EasyVista Service Manager, which is a software alike Atlassian Jira, ServiceNow, Tricentis and others).
  • Rev-Trac requests have custom text fields which are filled manually to store the ticket numbers of EV Service Manager. For information, long text custom fields were configured in the transaction code /RSC/CF42, appended to the table /RSC/T_RM_3H, a custom screen was created to contain these fields, and its screen number was set by implementing the function module exit /RSC/EI_CUSTOMER_EXIT_016 to add it to the "Additional fields" tab of the Rev-Trac requests screen.
    • For information, if you want to know where the user exits are called, display the where-used list of the function module /RSC/CE_GET_CUSTOMER_EXIT_NAME.
  • As far as I can see, there is no feature to do a full-text search in the custom text fields, so I created a custom program in another system to query the text fields, as I have no authorization to develop in the central system.
  • The program was created on an ABAP 7.40 SP 23 system.
  • NB: if you want more information about Rev-Trac, it's a software by Revelation Software Concepts https://revelationsoftwareconcepts.com/. Its specific Web site is https://rev-trac.com/. There's also a documentation at Rev-Trac User Guides Home - Rev-Trac Resources - Confluence. NB: in case you ask, I'm not affiliated to RSC and Rev-Trac in any way.

 

What is the Rev-Trac API?

The Rev-Trac API 7.2.0 is based on RFC-enabled function modules which are prefixed /RSC/API_ and belong to the package /RSC/DEV_API.

These function modules may be called from another ABAP system by using an RFC destination described in the next chapter.

Examples of API:

  • /RSC/API_CREATE_RT_REQUEST
  • /RSC/API_GET_REQUESTS
  • /RSC/API_UPDATE_RT_REQUEST
  • /RSC/API_UPDATE_RT_STATUS
  • /RSC/API_GET_MASTER_RFC_DEST

There is a convention for the parameter names:

  • They are prefixed "P"
  • The second character can be:
    • "S": structure
    • "W": simple field
    • "T": table
      • They are always passed through TABLES parameters.
  • The third character indicates if the parameter is to be input or output, which is especially useful for TABLES parameters:
    • "I": input parameter
    • "E": output parameter

The read API have boolean parameters used to indicate which kind of data you want to retrieve (none by default).

The update API insert, update or delete the table data directly without sending to the SAP update task and they don't commit explicitly. Either you call BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT explicitly or a database commit is done implicitly when the RFC connection ends (or rollback if it fails).

 

Rev-Trac RFC destination

Before calling a Rev-Trac function module, the RFC destination must be queried. In all the systems which connect to the central Rev-Trac system, the table /RSC/T_CEM_PARMS contains one line (SYSID = current system and PARM = "MASTER") which indicates what the central system is. The Rev-Trac RFC destination names are prefixed "Y/RSC/RFC".

This RFC destination may be obtained by calling the function module /RSC/API_GET_MASTER_RFC_DEST:

    DATA rfc_destination TYPE rfcdest.
    CALL FUNCTION '/RSC/API_GET_MASTER_RFC_DEST'
      EXPORTING
        pwi_dialog      = 'X'
        pwi_prefer_none = 'X'
      IMPORTING
        pwe_dest        = rfc_destination
      EXCEPTIONS
        not_found       = 1
        OTHERS          = 2.

 

/RSC/API_GET_REQUESTS

This function module is used to query the Rev-Trac requests to obtain all information. If you only need the main fields like the text or the last modification date, you may use /RSC/API_SEARCH_REQUESTS.

The following parameters are used by the custom program:

  • PWI_GET_REQUEST_DETAILS: boolean to retrieve the values of the main fields like the last modification date
  • PWI_GET_CUSTOM_LONG: boolean to retrieve the values of the custom long text fields
  • PTI_FILTER_MDATE: filter the requests by the last modification date
  • PTE_REQUEST_DETAILS: main fields like the last modification date
  • PTE_CUSTOM_LONG: values of the custom long text fields

 

Program to extract the custom long text fields of requests

First of all, a custom table must be created to allow a fast search (except the first time, it must be filled completely). The program will query the requests changed recently, store the data in this custom table and query it.

Table ZRSC_REQ_COPY

define table zrsc_req_copy {
key mandt: mandt not null;
key req: /rsc/req not null;
    mdate: /rsc/mdate;
    zzfield_1_len: /rsc/lcharlen;
    zzfield_1: /rsc/customlongtext;
    zzfield_2_len: /rsc/lcharlen;
    zzfield_2: /rsc/customlongtext;
}

 

ABAP Code

REPORT zindex_revtrac.

PARAMETERS p_req TYPE /rsc/req NO-DISPLAY.
PARAMETERS p_search TYPE c LENGTH 9 OBLIGATORY.

CLASS lcl_app DEFINITION DEFERRED.
DATA go_app TYPE REF TO lcl_app.

START-OF-SELECTION.
  CREATE OBJECT go_app TYPE ('LCL_APP').
  CALL METHOD go_app->('MAIN').
  ASSERT 1 = 1. " debug helper

CLASS lcl_app DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    METHODS main.

  PRIVATE SECTION.

      BEGIN OF ts_tq_excerpt,
        trkorr TYPE tmsbuffer-trkorr,
      END OF ts_tq_excerpt.
    TYPES tt_buffer TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tmsbuffer WITH DEFAULT KEY.

    METHODS search_rt.

ENDCLASS.


CLASS lcl_rev_trac_api DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    TYPES tt_filter_req         TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_api_001 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_filter_proj        TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_api_001 WITH DEFAULT KEY.

    TYPES tt_filter_cdate       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_api_001 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_filter_mdate       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_api_001 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_filter_textu       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_api_001 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_filter_module      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_api_001 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_filter_ustat       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_api_001 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_filter_relse       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_api_001 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_filter_kwords      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_api_001 WITH DEFAULT KEY.

    TYPES tt_filter_pri         TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_api_001 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_filter_saprl       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_api_001 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_requests           TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_rm_3_23 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_request_details    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/t_rm_3a WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_custom_fields      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/t_rm_3h WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_custom_long        TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/t_rm_3hl WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_history_log        TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_ce_0_107 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_spec_mig_ins       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_ce_0_107 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_attachments        TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_bd_2_04 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_reference_list     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_ce_0_108 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_reference_details  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_rm_3_24 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_dynamic_links      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_ce_0_109 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_xd_package_details TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_xd_0_02 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_abap_components    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_mf_4_34 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_xd_dependencies    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_dp_0_07 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_msg_header         TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_rm_3_15 WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_msg_items          TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF /rsc/s_rm_3_16 WITH DEFAULT KEY.

    TYPES: BEGIN OF ts_get_requests,
             BEGIN OF import,
               pwi_get_request_details     TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_custom_fields       TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_custom_long         TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_history_log         TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_spec_mig_ins        TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_attachments         TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_ref_list            TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_rererence_details   TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_dynamic_links       TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_tx_list             TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_abap_components     TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_xd_list             TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_xd_details          TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_xd_depd             TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_non_abap_components TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_get_approvals           TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_uname                   TYPE /rsc/syuname,
               pwi_filter_smi              TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_filter_owner            TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_filter_programmer       TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_filter_customizer       TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_filter_actor            TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_filter_standin          TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_filter_signer           TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_filter_last_modifier    TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pwi_filter_creator          TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pti_filter_req              TYPE tt_filter_req,
               pti_filter_proj             TYPE tt_filter_proj,
               pti_filter_rtype            TYPE tt_filter_rtype,
               pti_filter_class            TYPE tt_filter_class,
               pti_filter_team             TYPE tt_filter_team,
               pti_filter_status           TYPE tt_filter_status,
               pti_filter_cdate            TYPE tt_filter_cdate,
               pti_filter_mdate            TYPE tt_filter_mdate,
               pti_filter_textu            TYPE tt_filter_textu,
               pti_filter_module           TYPE tt_filter_module,
               pti_filter_ustat            TYPE tt_filter_ustat,
               pti_filter_relse            TYPE tt_filter_relse,
               pti_filter_kwords           TYPE tt_filter_kwords,
               pti_filter_userid           TYPE tt_filter_userid,
               pti_filter_sevr             TYPE tt_filter_sevr,
               pti_filter_pri              TYPE tt_filter_pri,
               pti_filter_saprl            TYPE tt_filter_saprl,
             END OF import,
             BEGIN OF export,
               pte_non_abap_components TYPE /rsc/tt_mf_005,
               "! Filled only if PWI_GET_TX_LIST = 'X'
               pte_transports          TYPE /rsc/tt_mf_007,
               pte_xd_list             TYPE /rsc/tt_xd_004,
               pte_approvals           TYPE /rsc/tt_rm_003,
               pwe_date_stamp          TYPE /rsc/sydatum,
               pwe_time_stamp          TYPE /rsc/syuzeit,
               pwe_result              TYPE /rsc/flag,
               pte_requests            TYPE tt_requests,
               pte_request_details     TYPE tt_request_details,
               pte_custom_fields       TYPE tt_custom_fields,
               pte_custom_long         TYPE tt_custom_long,
               pte_history_log         TYPE tt_history_log,
               pte_spec_mig_ins        TYPE tt_spec_mig_ins,
               pte_attachments         TYPE tt_attachments,
               pte_reference_list      TYPE tt_reference_list,

    CLASS-METHODS api_get_requests
      IMPORTING VALUE(import) TYPE ts_get_requests-import
      RETURNING VALUE(result) TYPE ts_get_requests-export.

    CLASS-METHODS class_constructor.

  PRIVATE SECTION.
    CLASS-DATA w_rfcdest TYPE /rsc/s_cem_0_10-rfcdest.

ENDCLASS.


CLASS ltc_main DEFINITION
  FOR TESTING RISK LEVEL HARMLESS DURATION SHORT.

  PRIVATE SECTION.
    METHODS test FOR TESTING.
ENDCLASS.


CLASS ltc_main IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD test.
    DATA requests_2 TYPE lcl_rev_trac_api=>ts_get_requests-export ##NEEDED.

    cl_abap_unit_assert=>fail( msg   = 'FOR DEBUG ONLY'
                               level = if_aunit_constants=>tolerable ).
    requests_2 = lcl_rev_trac_api=>api_get_requests(
                     import = VALUE #( pwi_get_request_details     = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_custom_fields       = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_custom_long         = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_history_log         = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_spec_mig_ins        = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_attachments         = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_ref_list            = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_rererence_details   = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_dynamic_links       = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_tx_list             = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_abap_components     = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_xd_list             = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_xd_details          = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_xd_depd             = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_non_abap_components = abap_true
                                       pwi_get_approvals           = abap_true
*                                       pwi_get_tx_list             = 'X'
*                                       pwi_get_request_details     = 'X'
                                       pti_filter_req              = VALUE #( ( low = '0000004116' ) )
*                                       pti_filter_mdate            = VALUE #( ( low = '20241007' ) )
                                       ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.


CLASS lcl_app IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD main.
    IF p_search IS NOT INITIAL.
      search_rt( ).
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD search_rt.
    TYPES tt_zrsc_req_copy TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zrsc_req_copy WITH EMPTY KEY.

    SELECT MAX( mdate ) FROM zrsc_req_copy INTO (max_mdate).
    DATA(requests) = lcl_rev_trac_api=>api_get_requests(
                         VALUE #( pwi_get_request_details = 'X'
                                  pwi_get_custom_long     = 'X'
                                  pti_filter_mdate        = VALUE #( ( low = max_mdate high = sy-datum ) ) ) ).
    DATA(lt_zrsc_req_copy) = VALUE tt_zrsc_req_copy(
        FOR GROUPS <group_by_request> OF <custom_long> IN requests-pte_custom_long
        GROUP BY ( request = <custom_long>-request )
        LET table_temp_custom_long = VALUE lcl_rev_trac_api=>TT_custom_long( for <temp_custom_long> in group <group_by_request>
                                          ( <temp_custom_long> ) )
            zzfield_1 = table_temp_custom_long[ fieldname = 'ZZFIELD_1' ]-long_text
            zzfield_2 = table_temp_custom_long[ fieldname = 'ZZFIELD_2' ]-long_text
        IN
        ( req           = <group_by_request>-request
          mdate         = VALUE #( requests-pte_request_details[ request = <group_by_request>-request ]-mdate OPTIONAL )
          zzfield_1_len = strlen( zzfield_1 )
          zzfield_1     = zzfield_1
          zzfield_2_len = strlen( zzfield_2 )
          zzfield_2     = zzfield_2 ) ).
    MODIFY zrsc_req_copy FROM TABLE lt_zrsc_req_copy.
    COMMIT WORK.
    FREE lt_zrsc_req_copy.

    " NB: with ABAP SQL, impossible to filter LCHR columns via WHERE.
    SELECT *
      FROM zrsc_req_copy
      INTO TABLE _zrsc_req_copy.

    " Filter in ABAP
    DATA(filter) = |*{ p_search }*|.
    DELETE lt_zrsc_req_copy WHERE zzfield_1 NP filter.

    requests = lcl_rev_trac_api=>api_get_requests(
                   VALUE #( pwi_get_request_details = 'X'
                            pti_filter_req          = VALUE #( FOR <ls_zrsc_req_copy> IN lt_zrsc_req_copy
                                                               ( low = <ls_zrsc_req_copy>-req ) ) ) ).
    LOOP AT lt_zrsc_req_copy REFERENCE INTO DATA(ls_zrsc_req_copy).
      DATA(ls_pte_request_detail) = REF #( requests-pte_request_details[ request = ls_zrsc_req_copy->req ] ).
      WRITE : / ls_zrsc_req_copy->req,
                ls_pte_request_detail->text.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.


CLASS lcl_rev_trac_api IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD api_get_requests.
    CALL FUNCTION '/RSC/API_GET_REQUESTS'
      DESTINATION w_rfcdest
      EXPORTING
        pwi_get_request_details     = import-pwi_get_request_details
        pwi_get_custom_fields       = import-pwi_get_custom_fields
        pwi_get_custom_long         = import-pwi_get_custom_long
        pwi_get_history_log         = import-pwi_get_history_log
        pwi_get_spec_mig_ins        = import-pwi_get_spec_mig_ins
        pwi_get_attachments         = import-pwi_get_attachments
        pwi_get_ref_list            = import-pwi_get_ref_list
        pwi_get_rererence_details   = import-pwi_get_rererence_details
        pwi_get_dynamic_links       = import-pwi_get_dynamic_links
        pwi_get_tx_list             = import-pwi_get_tx_list
        pwi_get_abap_components     = import-pwi_get_abap_components
        pwi_get_xd_list             = import-pwi_get_xd_list
        pwi_get_xd_details          = import-pwi_get_xd_details
        pwi_get_xd_depd             = import-pwi_get_xd_depd
        pwi_get_non_abap_components = import-pwi_get_non_abap_components
        pwi_get_approvals           = import-pwi_get_approvals
        pwi_uname                   = import-pwi_uname
        pwi_filter_smi              = import-pwi_filter_smi
        pwi_filter_owner            = import-pwi_filter_owner
        pwi_filter_programmer       = import-pwi_filter_programmer
        pwi_filter_customizer       = import-pwi_filter_customizer
        pwi_filter_actor            = import-pwi_filter_actor
        pwi_filter_standin          = import-pwi_filter_standin
        pwi_filter_signer           = import-pwi_filter_signer
        pwi_filter_last_modifier    = import-pwi_filter_last_modifier
        pwi_filter_creator          = import-pwi_filter_creator
      IMPORTING
        pte_non_abap_components     = result-pte_non_abap_components
        pte_transports              = result-pte_transports
        pte_xd_list                 = result-pte_xd_list
        pte_approvals               = result-pte_approvals
        pwe_date_stamp              = result-pwe_date_stamp
        pwe_time_stamp              = result-pwe_time_stamp
      TABLES
        pti_filter_req              = import-pti_filter_req
        pti_filter_proj             = import-pti_filter_proj
        pti_filter_rtype            = import-pti_filter_rtype
        pti_filter_class            = import-pti_filter_class
        pti_filter_team             = import-pti_filter_team
        pti_filter_status           = import-pti_filter_status
        pti_filter_cdate            = import-pti_filter_cdate
        pti_filter_mdate            = import-pti_filter_mdate
        pti_filter_textu            = import-pti_filter_textu
        pti_filter_module           = import-pti_filter_module
        pti_filter_ustat            = import-pti_filter_ustat
        pti_filter_relse            = import-pti_filter_relse
        pti_filter_kwords           = import-pti_filter_kwords
        pti_filter_userid           = import-pti_filter_userid
        pti_filter_sevr             = import-pti_filter_sevr
        pti_filter_pri              = import-pti_filter_pri
        pti_filter_saprl            = import-pti_filter_saprl
        pte_requests                = result-pte_requests
        pte_request_details         = result-pte_request_details
        pte_custom_fields           = result-pte_custom_fields
        pte_custom_long             = result-pte_custom_long
        pte_history_log             = result-pte_history_log
        pte_spec_mig_ins            = result-pte_spec_mig_ins
        pte_attachments             = result-pte_attachments
        pte_reference_list          = result-pte_reference_list
        pte_reference_details       = result-pte_reference_details
        pte_dynamic_links           = result-pte_dynamic_links
        pte_xd_package_details      = result-pte_xd_package_details
        pte_abap_components         = result-pte_abap_components
        pte_xd_dependencies         = result-pte_xd_dependencies
        pte_msg_header              = result-pte_msg_header
        pte_msg_items               = result-pte_msg_items.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD class_constructor.
    CALL FUNCTION '/RSC/API_GET_MASTER_RFC_DEST'
      EXPORTING
        pwi_dialog      = 'X'
        pwi_prefer_none = 'X'
      IMPORTING
        pwe_dest        = w_rfcdest
      EXCEPTIONS
        not_found       = 1
        OTHERS          = 2.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

 

Thank you. Feel free to comment and post your own blog about Rev-Trac API.

Sandra

entry.title: Re: Issues with Data Monitor Logs and Manual Posting in G...
entry.content:
Hi Daniel
This is standard behavior in both S/4HANA On‑Premise and S/4HANA Cloud.
Manual Posting(1095) - This task never redirects to the posting screen
1095only checks whether a manual journal entry exists for the period/unit/version and marks itself as Completed once a posting is created.
You must open the Post Group Journal Entries app separately to create the posting.
==>Possible work around, but not desired, if you are on S/4HANA On‑Premise:
you can enhance the task type to include navigation, but this requires:
BAdI implementation
Custom task type
Custom UI action
If navigation is required, it must be added as a custom enhancement.

entry.title: Re: Business by Design Screentypes?
entry.content:
Hello thomas_mueller8,

The QC and TI screens are part of the "Thing-Based Navigation", which is valid only for SAP C4C (currently known as SAP Sales Cloud and Service Cloud), which Jens is using in his video.

The equivalent of these screens in ByD is:

  • OIF - Object Instance Floorplan (for TI)
  • QAF - Quick Activity Floorplan (for QC).

They belong to the "Object-Based Navigation" which is used in ByD.

You can refer to below help pages related to screen types for further information:
Generate Screens for a Business Object
Screen Types 
Object-Based Navigation and Thing-Based Navigation

Also, Jens videos are present in these two blogs:
Video-How-To's for SAP Cloud Applications Studio 
Getting started with the Cloud Application Studio - New video series 

I hope this helps!

Best regards,
Thiago

entry.title: Re: Issues with Data Monitor Logs and Manual Posting in G...
entry.content:
Appologies for the late response, you may have sorted out the issue
This is standard behavior in both S/4HANA On‑Premise and S/4HANA Cloud. - Manual posting / 1095 - this task never redirects to the posting screen, since its not a tracking task and not an execution task
If you on S/4 HANA On-Premise you can check the option of enhancing the task type to include navigation (not easy as said!) this would require:
BAdI implementation, Custom task type, Custom UI action
if this is an end user requirement, Train the users on SAP standard behavior

entry.title: Small program to test the SCSM_NW_WORKLOAD interface for reading ABAP statistics data
entry.content:
The "SCSM_NW_WORKLOAD interface" corresponds to the SAP note 1053634 - SCSM_NW_WORKLOAD interface for reading ABAP statistics data - SAP for Me. In fact, it's the name of the function group containing the function modules which can be called to read the ABAP statistics data (data displayed by the transaction codes ST03, ST03N, STAT).

There are very few code snippets about these function modules, so I decided to publish a little test program which calls these function modules. This program is useful in debug to find out how the ABAP statistics data are structured, to build your own program with the data you need.

The program calls the following RFC-enabled function modules:

  • SWNC_GET_DIRECTORY_FRAME
  • SWNC_GET_AGGREGATES_FRAME
  • SWNC_GET_SNAPSHOT_FRAME
  • SWNC_GET_STATRECS_FRAME

It calls SWNC_GET_DIRECTORY_FRAME and SWNC_GET_AGGREGATES_FRAME to read the whole aggregated data (total and by server).

It calls SWNC_GET_SNAPSHOT_FRAME and SWNC_GET_STATRECS_FRAME to read the detailed records of ABAP statistics data of the last 3 days, with a time frame of 60 minutes (these filter and setting can be changed).

I used this program in an ABAP 7.40 SP 23 system.

Happy coding and feel free to publish your own code snippets!

Sandra

REPORT z_read_st03n_data.
* Note 1053634:
* With the SAP upgrade to SAP_BASIS 7.0(NW 2004s), both the methods and
* the corresponding function modules for reading ABAP statistics data
* have changed. The SAPWL_GLOB_STAT function group can no longer be
* used as of SAP_BASIS 7.0.
* (SAPWL_GLOB_STAT = SAPWL_STATREC_FROM_REMOTE_SYS, etc.)
* The new function group includes the following four function modules:
* - SWNC_GET_DIRECTORY_FRAME
* - SWNC_GET_AGGREGATES_FRAME
* - SWNC_GET_SNAPSHOT_FRAME
* - SWNC_GET_STATRECS_FRAME
DATA(select_from_systems) = VALUE swncgl_t_dest( ).
DATA(all_directories)  = VALUE swncgl_t_alldir( ).
DATA(protocol_allrcinf) = VALUE swncgl_t_allrcinf( ).

select_from_systems = VALUE #(
  ( select_system  = sy-sysid
*    select_servers =
) ).
CALL FUNCTION 'SWNC_GET_DIRECTORY_FRAME'
  EXPORTING
    select_from_systems = select_from_systems "sy-sysid
  IMPORTING
    all_directories     = all_directories
    protocol            = protocol_allrcinf.

DATA(select_system) = VALUE swncsysdest( ).
DATA(systemid) = VALUE swncsysid( ).
DATA(instance) = VALUE swnchostname( ).
DATA(periodtype) = VALUE swncperitype( ).
DATA(periodstrt) = VALUE swncdatum( ).
DATA(summary_only) = VALUE swnc_cflag( ).
DATA(tasktype) = VALUE swncgl_t_aggtasktype( ).
DATA(tasktimes) = VALUE swncgl_t_aggtasktimes( ).
DATA(times) = VALUE swncgl_t_aggtimes( ).

entry.title: Re: SAP Analytical Queries Previous Year
entry.content:
Good day @Rawel 

Thank you for your question

In summary, you can create restricted measures to show this year and last year side by side in Custom Analytical Queries but the app does not support deriving a second prompt value when you create it inside the query prompt. So, you cannot have a single Year input and automatically fill Previous Year as year minus 1 purely in the query. See Custom Analytical Queries and Services and Creating Analytical Queries for more insights.

Here is a step-by-step guide:

In your system, open Custom Analytical Queries, then open either your existing query or create a new one on your production data source.


Go to Field Selection and ensure you have your time characteristic available, either your Fiscal Year or Calendar Year, depending on your cube. (using an existing sample for reference in this case).

Go to Measures and create: Restricted Measure 1: Current Year Quantity, Restrict by year= Prompt (P_Year_Current) & Restricted Measure 2: Previous Year Quantity, Restrict by Year= Prompt (P_Year_Previous).

Then go to Display or Field Selection, put your dimensions (material, plant, etc.) in Rows and put the two restricted measures in columns.

Save and run the query.

If you only require one user input, then do it in Analytics Cloud. Embedded Custom Analytical Queries alone will not calculate previous year from the entered year.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Drive more Business Value out of your SAP Public Cloud Solution Subscriptions.
entry.content:
Hi Egbert,
 
The actual usage depends on the application. To simplify, let's focus on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, and SAP S/4HANA on-premise.
 
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, there isn't a report that shows your users per application. However, you can look at usage by Fiori App in several ways:
- In SAP for Me, you can view a Usage report that shows the most used SAP Fiori Apps for the customer.
- You can also perform user tracing using the App Display Authorization Trace to understand user usage.

 

- The Early Watch Report included in SAP for Me shows you the top apps used by application area and distinct users.

 

For SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, please refer to the following note: https://me.sap.com/notes/3203036/E 
 
For SAP S/4HANA on-premise systems, please refer to the following note: https://me.sap.com/notes/2629143/E 
 
Regarding your question about peer comparison, this is based on customers using the same solution within the same Mastercode (Industry), independent of the size of the customer.
 
Hope this helps,
Best regards,
Marco

entry.title: How to Take SAP’s New Performance-Based Certification Exams
entry.content:
Beginning in November 2025, SAP updated parts of its certification program by introducing scenario-based assessments exams. These exams replace the traditional proctored, multiple-choice format and are designed to better reflect real-world use cases.

In this post, I walk you through what has changed, how the new exam formats work, what to expect from AI-assisted and expert-reviewed assessments, and what this means for certification renewal—based on my own experience retaking the SAP BTP Solution Architect exam.

Some certifications are now available only through this new approach like:

With this new format, there is less focus on memorizing detailed information. Instead, candidates demonstrate their knowledge by solving practical scenarios. You may complete tasks using AI-assisted tools or submit video-based responses that are reviewed by SAP experts later.

 You can explore available certifications by logging into SAP Learning at https://learning.sap.com and navigating to the Get Certified section.

To identify the exam format, click on the exam you are interested in. On the above right side of the exam page, the presence of “Schedule Exam” indicates that the exam is delivered through a third-party proctoring service:

 

According to the SAP latest announcement, all SAP exams (by the end of March 2026) will be switched to this self-managed new performance-based exam.

If you choose the AI option with this new approach, the results are reviewed automatically in real time right after your submission. You can see your failure or success immediately. If you fail, you will receive the detailed analysis of your response by AI which can help you with your next exam try.

If you choose to submit videos, it will be scored by experts within 10 business days.

This analyzing session will not be available to you in your next log on, please make sure to review that before missing that session to help you to focus on your weakness for your next same exam try.

How real skills are used in scenario based

Practical

Certification exams mimic real tasks, such as configuring real SAP systems, building processes, coding, or delivering SAP solutions based on a case study.

Open book

Leverage all kinds of resources to complete the exams, just as you would on an actual SAP project. 

AI-enabled

Access AI support, such as SAP Joule for Consultants or any other AI Large Language Models (LLMs).

System-based assessment

Learners have the opportunity to complete practical tasks in time-limited SAP system simulations, testing their ability to perform specific tasks or operations.

Scenario-based assessment

Learners engage in time-limited role-play with an AI avatar, delivering SAP solutions, advising on architecture, and performing simulations.

A subscription to SAP Learning Hub includes 4 SAP certification exam attempts in one year or you can buy certification attempts (LINK).

At the time of writing this blog, to renew a certification for an additional year, you must have an active SAP Learning Hub subscription to complete the required renewal assessment:

If your certification is still valid, the renewal process does not require taking a performance-based or scenario-based exam. This exam formats apply only when pursuing a new certification, provided that the certification has already transitioned to the new scenario-based or practical exam approach.

Recently I decided to retake SAP BTP Solution Architect rather than renew through leaning Hub assessment to help me to write this post.

Here I walk you through high level steps:

First, you find your desired Exam page and click on the link:

https://learning.sap.com/certifications/sap-certified-professional-solution-architect-sap-btp

Next you choose “Go to Certification Exam”:

Then, you see the screen below and after clicking the box for “Terms and Conditions” you can hit “start Certification Exam” that will use one of your exam attempts credits and you have 24 hours to do the exam, or you lose one of your exams attempts credits:

As shown above, you have up to four exam attempts within a one-year period to achieve certification. If all four attempts are unsuccessful, you must wait 12 months before retaking the same exam.

Next, you will see the page below, which I chose AI for my Role-play then click on “Agree and get Started”:

Then you see the next screen and after allowing your camera, you will be able to start the exam by clicking on Start button:

Important note: Once you start the exam session, the assessment typically takes around 20–30 minutes and is conducted through an AI-powered chat experience using Yoodli technology. Before clicking on Start button, it is strongly recommended that you thoroughly review the case study PDF provided as part of the exam and prepare your solution in advance, for example in a notepad or word document, which you can reference during the AI role-play conversation.

This exam uses Yoodli technology and does not require any software installation. If you would like to familiarize yourself with the format, you can create a free account at https://yoodli.ai/ and practice using sample role-play scenarios.

During the exam, an interactive chat window will appear, allowing you to follow the conversation and view a live transcript of the AI avatar’s responses.

Areas Where There Is Still Room for Improvement

While this new exam approach is a positive step forward, there are still areas that could benefit from further refinement. In particular, it would help to ensure that participants clearly understand the scenario or practice environment and easily find sufficient time to review the requirements and prepare their responses before starting the session.

Compared to traditional proctored exams, there are also open questions around identity verification. It is not yet clear how this new format consistently confirms that the individual completing the assessment is the same person who registered for the exam.

In addition, with the new exam approach, candidates do not currently receive an automatic email notification showing pass or fail status, scores, or a detailed performance analysis.

Hopefully, the SAP certification team will continue to enhance this model so that it aligns more closely with traditional proctored exams in these areas

Reference links:

Reimagining certification in the age of AI
Step-by-step guide - How to cancel your existing booking for a certification exam?

 Share with others and Connect with us!

Please leave your comment if you have anything to add!
If you would like to ask questions, please use the community Q&A.
Give us a like and share on social media if you feel it was useful!
You can check my posts and follow me in People SAP @Amin_Omidy 

Thanks, and wish you a happy reading!

By the looks it seems as if i need to add my business system in MDG_BUS_SYS_BO. The guide doesn't explain what to do when encountering such an issue. Is it because the MDG portal is also live in our organization? What are the steps that i should proceed with next?

@ManoelCosta @marcobarat
